根据上下文，问题“What is GRPO”可以由上下文中的“Group Relative Policy Optimization In order to save the training costs of RL”和“Specifically, for each question 𝑞, GRPO samples a group of outputs {𝑜1, 𝑜2, · · · , 𝑜𝐺} from the old policy 𝜋𝜃𝑜𝑙𝑑 and then optimizes the policy model 𝜋𝜃 by maximizing the following objective”得出。因此，GRPO指的是通过群组得分的平均来估计基准，从而优化政策的方法。因此，问题的答案是GRPO是Group Relative Policy Optimization，用于减少RL训练成本的方法，基于上文中的信息，可以确定这是一个优化方法，用于减少RL的训练成本。
</think>

Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) is an optimization method introduced by Shao et al. (2024) to reduce the training costs of reinforcement learning (RL). It avoids the need for a critic model that is typically the same size as the policy model by estimating the baseline based on group scores. Specifically, for each question \( q \), GRPO samples a group of outputs \( \{o_1, o_2, \ldots, o_G\} \) from the old policy \( \pi_{\text{old}} \) and optimizes the policy model \( \pi \) to maximize the following objective.

Therefore, the answer is GRPO is Group Relative Policy Optimization, a method used to reduce the training costs of RL by estimating the baseline from group scores.

\boxed{GRPO}

context.text: Group Relative Policy Optimization In order to save the training costs of RL, we adopt Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) (Shao et al., 2024), which foregoes the critic model that is typically the same size as the policy model, and estimates the baseline from group scores instead. Specifically, for each question 𝑞, GRPO samples a group of outputs {𝑜1, 𝑜2, · · · , 𝑜𝐺} from the old policy 𝜋𝜃𝑜𝑙𝑑 and then optimizes the policy model 𝜋𝜃 by maximizing the following objective:
